triples.name: Simplicial complex
triples.relevance: The paper applies simplicial complexes to model higher-order interactions in multilayer networks for epidemics, enabling representation of group interactions beyond pairwise connections.

triples.name: Multidimensional network
triples.relevance: The multilayer network model framework is used to combine a virtual social network layer with a physical contact network layer.

triples.name: Social network
triples.relevance: Social networks form one layer of the multilayer model, responsible for information transmission through pairwise and higher-order interactions.

triples.name: Compartmental models (epidemiology)
triples.relevance: The paper applies epidemiological modeling concepts to study disease transmission and outbreak thresholds in the physical contact network layer.

triples.name: Markov chain
triples.relevance: The microscopic Markov chain approach is used to derive probability transition equations for the epidemic dynamics.

triples.name: Monte Carlo method
triples.relevance: Monte Carlo simulations validate the analytical results and confirm agreement with theoretical predictions of the model.
